info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued October 10 at 5:07AM EDT until October 10 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Upton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Statement, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the Coastal Flood Watch, one to two, locally three feet of inundation above ground level possible in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline.
* WHERE...Southern Nassau County.
* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Statement, from 9 AM this morning to noon EDT today. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Sunday morning through Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...For the coastal flood statement, brief minor flooding of the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. For the Coastal Flood Watch, widespread flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline, including roads, parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront is possible.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For Sunday into Monday, 8 to 12 foot breaking waves are possible along the oceanfront resulting in areas of beach erosion.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON EDT TODAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON
